definition: The End (appearing at the end of a movie etc)
theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe

sentences.english: At the end of the play he was very happy because she married a good young man.
sentences.chinese: 劇終時他很高興，因爲她與一個很好的年輕人結了婚。

sentences.english: At the of the play Hamlet avenged his fathers death on the murderer.
sentences.chinese: 劇終時哈姆雷特死兇手，報了父之仇。
講故事時間結束了，劇終。

sentences.english: At the end of the play, Hamlet avenged his father's death upon the murderer.
sentences.chinese: 劇終時，漢姆萊特殺死兇手，爲父親報了仇。

sentences.english: After the play the actors and actresses took five curtain calls.
sentences.chinese: 劇終後演員們謝幕達五次之多。

definition: to rupture/to burst open/to break/to break off relations with/a rupture
hard to explain in a few words (idiom); complicated and not easy to express succinctly
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
interlude/to cross the stage/to do sth as a mere formality/to go through the motions
lit. draw legs on a snake (idiom); fig. to ruin the effect by adding sth superfluous/to overdo it
to go separate ways (idiom)/to part ways with sb/Taiwan pr. [ge4 ben1 dong1 xi1]
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
first awakening of love (usually of a girl) (idiom)
to die peacefully/(fig.) to result in failure (without any outside interference)/to come to nothing/to fizzle out
lit. find a stage, put on a comedy (idiom); to join in the fun/to play along according to local conditions
